title: If our life is an illusion, how could we get out of it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Take a hammer, put your thumb on the table and hit your thumb with the hammer. If your life is an illusion you would not feel this, right?So this part is not so much illusion.Another experiment. Look at a solid building and try to see right through it, see what is happening at the other side. Fair chance this will not work. So again there must be something standing between us and the other side, else our view would not be blocked.  So we can be quite sure that sense impressions and what we call feelings exist. Then there is thinking. I recall this guy stating: 'cogito ergo sum'. At least for ourself our thinking is real. Would be hard to deny this, right? I'm starting to wonder: how is our life an illusion?  There is a certain illusion however. The illusion that it's the hammer that is causing the pain, the illusion that the building is blocking our view. That our thinking exists independent of other impressions.If I cut your thumb, press a needle in it, put it on fire, you will hurt. Should we blame those outside influences or our thumb? If we see a train, a car, a bird, a human, an animal, they are blocking our view. Should we blame those outside influences or our eyes which are not suited to look through solid forms? If we think good thoughts, bad thoughts, unwanted thoughts, should we blame outside influences that cause this or should we look how those outside influences are dragged into the mind? Our head can go on fire by many sense impressions. Pleasant or unpleasant.  This is the illusion of life, that there is something outside responsible for our fortune and loss, pain and pleasure, status and disgrace, praise and critisism. If there is someone responsible it's the person picking it up. Stop picking these up and life has not many illusions left.

Everything that is perceived has some level of reality.  I am not sure what you mean by "illusion".  The human experience is a construct, building symbolic structures out of the neural messages of sensory organs.  That's experience.  It's an illusion.  It is not a direct reflection of physical reality.  The rainbow has no bands, you realize?  The rainbow spectral spread is continuous.  The color bands are qualia.  They are an artifact of how our eyes deliver information in response to light, not of light itself. Coping mechanisms are also illusions.  The self-talk we use to seek comfort is an illusion.  Escaping illusion is like trying to break out of a prison that is in a wasteland.  To what end?  At least the prison feeds you.  There is nowhere to go.

One would have to know who was having the illusion, and why. It it is a dream, presumably you would have to wake the dreamer. But would You still be there when the dreamer has woken. Perhaps you exist only within the illusion. And even of you do escape the illusion intact, how do you know it is better there? Perhaps you are the drug-dream of someone on massive doses of painkillers for an agonising disease.

Reality is not an illusion, but our perception of it is. The teaching of the sages is to let the dust and logs fall from your eyes. Normally meditation and direct investigation by oneself, leaving behind the preconceived world of parents, society and traditions. What are you willing to give up to know the truth?  Check out the teachings of Adyashanti and McKenna.

response.answer_text: Say "There's no place like home", three times fast.   If it doesn't work then your life is real. Now real doesn't mean we experience reality through a perfect lens.  There are obviously scales and spectra that we are blind to.   Our senses are not perfect in the realms in which they exist, and our senses do not include all senses that are possible or feasible.  But, there is no reason to think that an instrument we create that measures a scientific phenomena to a stated degree of accuracy is incorrect or completely erroneous.  Unless of course it is faulty, which can be confirmed.

You cannot get out of your life, nor should you try.  If life is an illusion, your job is as always to shine brightly enough to cast a shadow safe enough and strong enough to protect others from pain and suffering. If your goal is to truly escape an illusion, however, I suggest planting a tree in a flower pot, and then after it's about 5 years old, give it to someone else.  Nothing breaks down an illusion like a random tree.

Getting rid of illusions is also an illusion. You need to see everything directly without analyzing. See your thoughts, see the movement of your thoughts; see the division between thinker and the thoughts; then realize that the division itself is an illusion. Be ready to accept the end of all thought patterns and illusions.
Life is not an illusion as taught by void-ism. Rather its temporary manifestation and it keeps happening again and again. Yes so you should try to get out of this repeated cycle of birth and death.
If your life is an illusion, how can you get out of it? You cannot get out of something that isn’t there. As you yourself claim, if life is an illusion, there is no getting out!
